author: jcorvel
msg: Make it possible to run the 'benchmark suite1' on Windows, by translating
the bash script 'run' to a Windows batch script, 'run.bat'.
The Windows variant differs from the bash script on a couple of points:
- It doesn't 'tee' the output to a results.txt file, because I've found
no portable way to do this on Windows.  Of course, the output of running
'run.bat' can always be redirected to a file.
- The test 100x1 has been reduced to 25x1, to avoid running into the
maximum path length limitation on Windows (max. 256 characters).  Maybe
someone else can find a way to make this work (needs support in
benchmark.py).
* tools/dev/benchmarks/suite1/run.bat: New file, translation of 'run' into
a Windows batch script.

author: gstein
msg: Finish up the pausing code for the XML parsing. The primary change here is
to defer the close/free of the parser until *both* the network is
completed and the pending structures are empty.
Until I can complete some testing, this remains disabled.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/util.c:
(svn_ra_serf__pending_t): add NETWORK_EOF to indicate when the network
has been fully-read.
(HAS_PENDING_DATA): helper macro to see if there is pending content
(svn_ra_serf__process_pending): add logic to determine if all the
content has been consumed and processed. if so, then close up the
parser and finish.
(svn_ra_serf__handle_xml_parser): if pending data exists, then always
append arriving network content into the pending structures. avoid
closing and free'ing the parser if pending content exists. mark that
the network has completed.
